title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.1 Early Child Development (ECD) / PRE-SCHOOL

description.narrative: Output 1.1 (ECD / Pre-School): By 2020, the Ministry of Education will have mechanisms and instruments with which to implement an early education policy, with a regulatory and management framework, quality standards and a monitoring system and resources for its implementation., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1 (Education): By 2020, children and adolescents, particularly in rural, indigenous and disadvantaged urban areas, will have appropriate access to quality early education and will complete their lower secondary school education

participating-org.narrative: THE FOUNDATION FOR THE REFUGEE EDUCATION TRUST

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.1 (ECD / Pre-School): By 2020, the Ministry of Education will have mechanisms and instruments with which to implement anearly education policy, with a regulatory and management framework, quality standards and a monitoring system and resources for itsimplementation.

description.narrative: PCO continued to position as strategic partner for strengthening early childhood services by providing upstream technical assistance, generating evidence, implementing sustainable capacity-building platforms, and promoting early stimulation at home in the context of Covid-19. As a result of improved ECD coordination and joint programming of institutions with UNICEF’s technical assistance, this year Panama passed the first Law on Early Childhood Services that recognizes the importance of protection and early development as a national policy. In 2021, PCO will accompany the government to implement the ECD law to increase coverage and quality of services for children 0 to 5 years old. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2021
